distorOrdPrc.ordInstr: File name is NJ_Roadway_Network and it can be downloaded from the NJDOT website.

citRespParty.rpOrgName: New Jersey Department of Transportation (NJDOT), Bureau of Transportation Data and Safety (BTDS)
New Jersey Department of Transportation (NJDOT), Bureau of Transportation Data and Safety (BTDS)

dataIdInfo.idAbs: NJDOT has adopted a new data model for their transportation network. This data model was designed using portions of the ESRI UNETRANS data model, and incorporates existing data with more recent spatial and roadway inventory data. These data will encompass the NJDOT statewide road network, as well as public roads that fall outside of the NJDOT's jurisdiction. Roads were digitized using 2002 New Jersey statewide orthophotos, which were produced at a scale of 1:2400 (1"=200') with a 1 foot pixel resolution. The orthophotos were captured during February-April 2002, and were ortho-rectified to a +/- 4.0 foot horizontal accuracy at a 95% confidence level. Roads were digitized to the visible center of a street, within a tolerance of +/- 3 feet and then attributed using data collected for the Maintenance Management Systems and Local Road Inventory projects (2002-2005), which are both NJDOT BTDD data collection projects. Only public roads were digitized and attributed. Roads were digitized as divided where there was a visible, physical median separating carriageways for a length of greater than 600 feet. In the secondary direction, along median separated segments of roadway in the south and westbound directions, the milepost values are opposite to those in the primary direction. Ramps were digitized when the gore-to-gore distance was greater than 25 feet. This dataset does not include address range attributes. The project began in November 2003, and was completed by May 31, 2005.
dataIdInfo.idPurp: Provide a comprehensive road network of New Jersey that conforms to the NJDOT data model. This road network does not include private roads.

LegConsts.useLimit: The data will be provided as is. NJDOT BTDS will not assume any liability incurred by usage of this data.

Consts.useLimit: Contact: Donald O. Perry NJDOT GIS Specialist 1 1035 Parkway Ave. Trenton, NJ 08625 609-530-2945 Don.Perry@dot.nj.gov

report.measDesc: Topology checks were performed on the dataset in order to verify that the data was consistent and correct. Topology rules included: must not overlap; must not intersect; must not have dangles; and must not self-overlap.
Private roads were not digitized. These roads were not included in the newly adopted NJDOT Data Model.

MP_START MP_START and MP_END values were populated by data collected for the MMS and LRI projects for the NJDOT BTDD which are based on DMI. These data were collected from 2002-2005. Additional control points were used when applying M-values for routes greater than 5 miles in length. In instances were no inventory data exists (including, but not limited to, secondary direction of 500 series and lower) shape_length was used to approximate MP_START and MP_END. MP_END MP_START and MP_END values were populated by data collected for the MMS and LRI projects for the NJDOT BTDD which are based on DMI. These data were collected from 2002-2005. Additional control points were used when applying M-values for routes greater than 5 miles in length. In instances were no inventory data exists (including, but not limited to, secondary direction of 500 series and lower) shape_length was used to approximate MP_START and MP_END. MEASURED_LENGTH The MEASURED_LENGTH is derived from MP_END and MP_START values. MP_START and MP_END values were populated by data collected for the MMS and LRI projects for the NJDOT BTDD which are based on DMI. These data were collected from 2002-2005. Additional control points were used when applying M-values for routes greater than 5 miles in length. In instances were no inventory data exists (including, but not limited to, secondary direction of 500 series and lower) shape_length was used to approximate MP_START and MP_END. SRI In the case of a secondary direction SRI where the identifier already exists in the SLD database, the SRI was temporarily given a 'Z' suffix in order to maintain separation of linework and data. The SRI naming convention for NJ routes is as follows: CCMMRRRRSDQIPPPPP Where: CC - County code (00-21, see following pages). This will be 00 for all State, Interstate, US, Toll Authority, and 500 Routes. MM - The two digit municipality code (see following pages). This will be 00 for Interstate, US, Toll Authority and State Routes, and County Routes (500, 600, and 700 Series). RRRR - The four-digit road number. For numbered routes (Interstates, State and US routes), this number will be the posted route number (right-justified). S - The route suffix if one exists (B - Business; A - Alternate; S - Spur). For example, this would be "B" for US 1 Business. If a suffix does not exist, a "_" character will be used. D - The primary direction in which the route runs (N, S, E, W). This will be used for the secondary direction on divided highways. For undivided routes, or the primary direction of divided routes, a "_" character will be used. Q - Ramp Description. This character is reserved for the ramp description. The descriptions are as follows: A - Off ramp exiting the predominant route in the primary direction (increasing milepost readings) of the predominant route. B - On ramp entering the predominant route in the primary direction of the predominant route. C - Collector lanes in the primary direction of the predominant route. X - Off ramp exiting the predominant route in the secondary direction (decreasing milepost readings) of the predominant route. Y- On ramp entering the predominant route in the secondary direction of the predominant route. Z - Collector lanes in the secondary direction of the predominant route. For information on County and Municipal Codes, please see http://www.state.nj.us/transportation/refdata/sldiag/codes.pdf

Roads were digitized to the visible center of a street, within a tolerance of +/- 3 feet. Digitizers were trained to visually check work against the aerial. A random QC was complete to ensure consistency.

dataSource.srcDesc: Digital color infrared (CIR) orthophotography of New Jersey in State Plane NAD83 Coordinates, U.S. Survey Feet. The digital orthophotography was produced at a scale of 1:2400 (1"=200') with a 1 foot pixel resolution. Digital orthophotography combines the image characteristics of a photograph with the geometric qualities of a map. Digital orthophotography is a process which converts aerial photography from an original photo negative to a digital product that has been positionally corrected for camera lens distortion, vertical displacement and variations in aircraft altitude and orientation. Aerial photography of the entire State of New Jersey was captured during February-April, 2002. The ortho-rectification process achieved a +/-4.0 ft. horizontal accuracy at a 95% confidence level, National Standard for Spatial Data Accuracy (NSSDA). This dataset consists of 5000' x 5000' files in MrSID format with a 15:1 compresssion ratio. The files were produced utilizing MrSID Geospatial Edition 1.4 and are approximately 5 MB in size

citRespParty.rpOrgName: State of New Jersey Office of Information Technology - Office of Geographic Information Systems

dataSource.srcDesc: Currently no metadata exists. For a complete SLD data dictionary, please contact: Donald O. Perry GIS Specialist 1 Bureau of Transportation Data and Safety New Jersey Department of Transportation Phone: (609) 530-2945 Fax: (609) 530-3514

srcCitatn.otherCitDet: For a complete SLD data dictionary, please contact: Donald O. Perry GIS Specialist 1 Bureau of Transportation Data and Safety New Jersey Department of Transportation Phone: (609) 530-2945 Fax: (609) 530-3514

dataSource.srcDesc: Identification of public roads, attributes for road segments.

prcStep.stepDesc: Roads were then attributed and mileposted using data collected for the Maintenance Management Systems and Local Road Inventory projects (2002-2005), which are both NJDOT BTDD data collection projects.

Linework was digitized off of the 2002 statewide orthophotos to the visible center of a street, within a tolerance of +/- 3 feet. DGN's created for the Local Road Inventory project were used to determine whether a road was public or private. Only public roads were digitized.
The attribute field "SRI_DOTGIS" was added. This field is an abbreviated version of the SRI field in which trailing underbar characters have been removed where applicable.

All routes over 5 miles in length were calibrated using the route calibration tool within ArcGIS 8.3. A control point layer was created by using dynamic segmentation to plot select intersections from the da_intersection table in the SLD database onto the Roadway Network. Each control point was then snapped to the proper intersection. Once all control points were properly located, the calibrate routes wizard was run to produced newly calibrated routes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.

Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Topology checks were performed on the dataset in order to ensure that the data was consistent and correct. Topology rules included: must not overlap; must be single part; must not have dangles; and must not self-overlap. "SRI_OLD" field replaced the "SRI_DOTGIS" field that was present in previous versions.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.

Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Route 40Z no longer exists due to the realignment of US 40 and NJ 47. US 40 mileage shifted by 0.04 after MP 27.21. NJ 47 mileage shifted by 0.01.

Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. NJ166Z as been added due to a new alignment in the secondary direction of NJ 166 . A realignment on US 322 was incorporated at MP 17.84. US 322 was shifted by 0.06 after MP 17.84. NJ 47 mileage was reduced by 0.03 at MP 62.87.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Approximately 350 miles of new or updated local road miles were incorporated.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Approximately 220 miles of new or updated local road miles were incorporated.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Includes realignment of NJ 18 in New Brunswick and US 1 in Rahway. Also includes updates to ramps statewide based upon field inventory.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes.

Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Updates include: realignment of US 322/NJ 45 in Harrison Twp; realignment of US 9 at Cape May Ferry; updates to Hudson County routes to more accurately reflect county route numbers.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Updates include: Additions of 206 Bypass and 506SZ; and the realignments of US 1 Truck and the start of NJ 15.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes, which are reflected in the 2015 SLD.
Updated per revisions from updated inventory and route changes. Updates include NJ 18 extension in Piscataway to I 287 and the addition of US 22 express in Bridgewater.

attr.attrdef: Milepost End of the roadway segment.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Route identification number excluding route prefix.
Last date the record was updated.

The shared identifier of the highest level route segment that carries the mileage and defines the road number. These segment types include, but are not limited to, secondary direction, express lanes and ramps.
Generalized direction of the route segment.

attrdomv.udom: The following values may be present: "West to East"; "East to West"; "North to South"; "South to North"; "Null"

attr.attrdef: Route naming convention (Standard Route Identifier) for the route carriageway.

attrdomv.udom: The SRI naming convention for NJ routes is as follows: CCMMRRRRSDQIPPPPP Where: CC - County code (00-21, see following pages). This will be 00 for all State, Interstate, US, Toll Authority, and 500 Routes. MM - The two digit municipality code (see following pages). This will be 00 for Interstate, US, Toll Authority and State Routes, and County Routes (500, 600, and 700 Series). RRRR - The four-digit road number. For numbered routes (Interstates, State and US routes), this number will be the posted route number (right-justified). S - The route suffix if one exists (B - Business; A - Alternate; S - Spur). For example, this would be "B" for US 1 Business. If a suffix does not exist, a "_" character will be used. D - The primary direction in which the route runs (N, S, E, W). This will be used for the secondary direction on divided highways. For undivided routes, or the primary direction of divided routes, a "_" character will be used. Q - Ramp Description. This character is reserved for the ramp description. The descriptions are as follows: A - Off ramp exiting the predominant route in the primary direction (increasing milepost readings) of the predominant route. B - On ramp entering the predominant route in the primary direction of the predominant route. C - Collector lanes in the primary direction of the predominant route. X - Off ramp exiting the predominant route in the secondary direction (decreasing milepost readings) of the predominant route. Y- On ramp entering the predominant route in the secondary direction of the predominant route. Z - Collector lanes in the secondary direction of the predominant route. For information on County and Municipal Codes, please see http://www.state.nj.us/transportation/refdata/sldiag/codes.pdf

attr.attrdef: Abbreviated SRI. This field contains an abbreviated SRI (when applicable) by removing trailing underbar characters. This field replaces the "SRI_DOTGIS" field that was present in previous versions.
Milepost Start of the roadway segment.
Length of feature in internal units.
